metadata.description:
In honor of Pride Month “Freedom Bass” is a celebration of the radical and connective power of dance music. A disco-house track and call-to-arms for the queer and dance communities alike. 

A nostalgic, yet forward-thinking track, “Freedom Bass” a lyrical call to action for resistance and change set against a mashup of disco and 90’s house. Written during the pandemic, in the heart of lockdown, the song is filled with melancholy and a desire to return to the dance floor, surrounded by joyful crowds and uninhibited self-expression. 

“Freedom Bass was the first song that we ever wrote together in the basement of Boy Untitled's LA home during quarantine. This was long before we decided to become a boy band (lol) and like most first sessions, we were just feeling each other out to see if we would catch a vibe. We put the track down only to return to it a year later. Little did we know that this would become the thesis of BOY2K: 'The dance floor is the revolution...this is Music For The People.' Our mission as artists is to create spaces for people to come back "home" to. Spaces to find ourselves. Spaces to connect. Space to riot against systems of oppressions. Spaces to imagine the new world that we want to create together."

BOY2K’s mission is to make “Music For The People,” that is, music that celebrates the power of community. A community built in mutual support, love, acceptance and music that begs the listener to get up and move!

Learn more about BOY2K at www.boy2k.com.

lyrics.text:
Marching forward on the horizon line
Feel the heat of the night like it’s the first time 

Are we still sleeping 
Are we still numb
Are we drinking the poison
So we don’t wake up

Freedom bass
A riot on the dancefloor
Freedom bass
Screaming that we want more
In our hearts still knowing
Someday we would all come home
Come home
Freedom bass

Come home
Come home
Come home
Are we ever going back
Are we ever
Are we ever
Are we ever going back

Bodies in motion, shadows alive in the light
Hear the beat of my heart when I’m by your side
 
Feeling the rhythm
Feeling the drums
Pulling me under
Filling me up

Freedom bass
A riot on the dancefloor
Freedom bass
Screaming that we want more
In our hearts still knowing
Someday we would all come home
Come home
Freedom bass

Come home
Come home
Come home
Are we ever going back?
Are we ever
Are we ever
Are we ever going back?

The dance floor is the revolution
This is music for the people
This is music for the people
This is music for the people
